name: Magical Tarur?to-kun: Magic Adventure
description: Magical Taruruuto-kun: Magic Adventure is a Super Mario-style platformer based on the anime and manga of the same name. In the game Taru must cross levels in five worlds to reach and defeat Raivar to save Honmaru's girlfriend Iyona. Taru can attack enemies in a level with his tongue, and he can also eat the many takoyaki scattered throughout the level. Takoyaki can also function as platforms, though, so they shouldn't all be eaten. At the end of a level Taru can use the takoyaki he's eaten to purchase temporary power ups. On the worldmap taru can run into friends and enemies who will challenge Taru to minigames. Win and he gains extra takoyaki and powerups.

shot.caption: Title Screen
Talking with Honmaru on the world map.
Why would someone leave all these takoyaki just laying around?
I'll get to the bottom of this mystery!
Never did I think I could behold such beauty.
Taru spends his Takoyaki to buy powerups... but didn't he eat them?
Exploring a tower filled with mice and spirits.
Betting some takoyaki in the GAME Center's slot machine.
Audry is feeling feisty today.
Challenging a character on the world map to a game of cards.
Raivar summons a dragon for the first boss fight.
There are plenty of sharks down at the beach, and these will leap out of the water too.
A sunken ghost ship filled with the expected nasties.
In the second fight Raivar will shoot fireballs and rotate the arena whenever he is hit.
Snapped up by a stealthy magician eating planet.
The third boss flings fireballs all over the area as well as summoning vertical and horizontal pillars of fire.
I feel like I'm being watched.
Please don't eat me!
You... you're kidding, right?
Augh!
Game Over
